ibis.util
Class TypedProperties

java.lang.Object
  java.util.Dictionary<K,V>
      java.util.Hashtable<Object,Object>
          java.util.Properties
              ibis.util.TypedProperties
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Cloneable, Map<Object,Object>
Direct Known Subclasses:
UtilProperties
public class TypedProperties
extends Properties

Utility to extract and check typed properties.

See Also:
Serialized Form

getBooleanProperty

public boolean getBooleanProperty(String name)
Returns true if property name is defined and has a value that is conventionally associated with 'true' (as in Ant): any of 1, on, true, yes, or nothing.

Parameters:
name - property name
Returns:
true if property is defined and set

getBooleanProperty

public boolean getBooleanProperty(String key,
                                  boolean defaultValue)
Returns true if property name has a value that is conventionally associated with 'true' (as in Ant): any of 1, on, true, yes, or nothing. If the property is not defined, return the specified default value.

Parameters:
key - property name
defaultValue - the value that is returned if the property is absent
Returns:
true if property is defined and set

getSizeProperty

public long getSizeProperty(String key)
Returns the long value of a size property. Valid values for the property are a long, a long followed by K, a long followed by M or a long followed by G. Size modifiers multiply the value by 1024, 1024^2 and 1024^3 respectively.

Parameters:
key - property name
Returns:
the size value of property
Throws:
NumberFormatException - if the property is undefined or not a valid size

getSizeProperty

public long getSizeProperty(String key,
                            long defaultValue)
Returns the long value of a size property. Valid values for the property are a long, a long followed by K, a long followed by M or a long followed by G. Size modifiers multiply the value by 1024, 1024^2 and 1024^3 respectively. Returns the default value if the property is undefined.

Parameters:
key - property name
defaultValue - the default value
Returns:
the size value of property
Throws:
NumberFormatException - if the property is not a valid size

getStringList

public String[] getStringList(String key)
Returns the split-up value of a string property. The value is supposed to be a comma-separated string. See String.split(String) for details of the splitting. If the property is not defined, an empty array of strings is returned.

Parameters:
key - the property name
Returns:
the split-up property value.

getStringList

public String[] getStringList(String key,
                              String delim)
Returns the split-up value of a string property. The value is split up according to the specified delimiter. See String.split(String) for details of the splitting. If the property is not defined, an empty array of strings is returned.

Parameters:
key - the property name
delim - the delimiter
Returns:
the split-up property value.

getStringList

public String[] getStringList(String key,
                              String delim,
                              String[] defaultValue)
Returns the split-up value of a string property. The value is split up according to the specified delimiter. See String.split(String) for details of the splitting. If the property is not defined, the specified default value is returned.

Parameters:
key - the property name
delim - the delimiter
defaultValue - the default value
Returns:
the split-up property value.

stringPropertyMatch

public boolean stringPropertyMatch(String key,
                                   String match)
Returns true if property name is defined and has a string value that equals match.

Parameters:
key - property name
match - value to be matched
Returns:
true if property is defined and equals match

checkProperties

public TypedProperties checkProperties(String prefix,
                                       String[] validKeys,
                                       String[] validSubPrefixes,
                                       boolean printWarning)
Checks all properties with the given prefix for validity.

Parameters:
prefix - the prefix that should be checked
validKeys - the set of valid keys (all with the prefix).
validSubPrefixes - if a propery starts with one of these prefixes, it is declared valid
printWarning - if true, a warning is printed to standard error for each unknown property
Returns:
a Property object containing all unrecognized properties.

filter

public TypedProperties filter(String prefix,
                              boolean removePrefix,
                              boolean removeProperties)
Returns all properties who's key start with a certain prefix.

Parameters:
prefix - the desired prefix
removePrefix - should the prefix be removed from the property name?
removeProperties - should the returned properties be removed from the current properties?
Returns:
a Property object containing all matching properties.

filter

public TypedProperties filter(String prefix)
Returns all properties who's key start with a certain prefix.

Parameters:
prefix - the desired prefix
Returns:
a Property object containing all matching properties.

printProperties

public void printProperties(PrintStream out,
                            String prefix)
Prints properties (including default properties) to a stream.

Parameters:
out - The stream to write output to.
prefix - Only print properties which start with the given prefix. If null, will print all properties
